problem.p: Given the String objects s1 and s2 below:
What would be the returned value of the following comparisons?

div.p: The compareTo() instance method of the String class compares lexicographically the character sequence represented by the current String to the character sequence represented by the other String object.

A negative integer is returned when the current String is lexicographically less than the other String. A positive integer is returned when the current String is lexicographically greater than the other String. 0 is returned if the two Strings are equal.

In the first comparison, the character 'z' is lexicographically greater than the character 'A'. Thus a positive value is assigned to the variable v1. In the second comparison, the character 'Z' is lexicographically less than the character 'a. Thus, a negative value is assigned to the variable v2.
